gurmukhi: BUpiq jYso su pOrK kIno hY qYsI krI n iksI krnI ]liK j`Cin ikMnRnI rIJ rhI niB mY sB dyvn kI GrnI ]
transliteration: Bhoopat(i) Jaiso Su Paurakh Keeno Hai Taisikarina Kisikarnee|| Lakh(i) Jachchhan(i) Kinranirijh Rahinabh(i) Mai Sabh Devan Kigharnee||
translation: The king Kharag Singh exhibited extraordinary bravery, seeing which the women of Yakshas, Kinnars and gods are allured;

gurmukhi: miRd bwjq bIn miRdMg aupMg mucMg lIey auqrI DrnI ]sB nwcq gwvq rIJ rIJwvq XO aupmw kib ny brnI ]1702]
transliteration: Mrid Baajat Been Mridan Oupan Mouchannd Leee Outridharnee|| Sabh Naachat Gadvat Reejh Reejhaavat You Oupmaa Kabi Ne Barnee||1702
translation: They descended on the earth playing on their musical instruments like lyres, drums etc., and all are showing their pleasure by dancing and singing and making others pleased.1702.

gurmukhi: nB qy auqrI suMdrI skl lIey sur swj ]kvn hyq kib sXwm kih BUpq brby kwj ]1703]
transliteration: Nabh Te Outrisoundarisakal Leee Sur Saaj|| Kavan Het Kabi Syaam Kah(i) Bhoopat Barbe Kaaj||1703||
translation: The beautiful damsels came down from the sky aft3er embellishing themselves and the poet says that the objects of their coming was to wed the king.1703.

gurmukhi: muMf ibnw qb ruMf su BUpiq ko icq mY Aiq kop bFwXo ]dÍwds Bwn ju TwFy huqy kib sXwm khY iqh aUpr DwXo ]
transliteration: Mounnd Binaa Tab Round Su Bhoopat(i) Ko Chit Mai At(i) Kop Badhaayo|| Dvaadas Bhaan Ju Thaadhe Houte Kabi Syaam Kahai Tih Oopar Dhaayo||
translation: The headless king was extremely enraged in his mind and advanced towards the twelve Suryas;

gurmukhi: Bwj gey kr qRws soaU iSv TwFo rhXo iqh aUpir AwXo ]so niRp bIr mhw rnDIr ctwk cpyt dY BUm igrwXo ]1704]
transliteration: Bhaaj Gad Kar Traas Sooo Shiv Thaadho Rahyo Tih Oopar(i) Aayo|| So Nrip Beer Mahaa Randheer Chataak Chapet Dia Bhoom Giraayo||1704||
translation: They all ran away from that place, but Shiva kept standing there and fell upon him; but that mightly one caused Shiva to fall on the ground with his blow.1704.

gurmukhi: eykn mwr cpytn isau Aru eykn ko Dmkwr igrwvY ]cIr kY eykin fwr dey gih eykn ko niB Er clwvY ]
transliteration: Ekan Maar Chapetan Sio Ar(u) Ekan Ko Dhamkaar Giraavai|| Cheer Kai Ekan(i) Daar Dae Gadh Ekan(i) Ko Nabh(i) Or Chalaavai||
translation: Someone fell with his blow and someone with the thumping of that blow; he ripped and threw someone towards the sky;

gurmukhi: bwj isau bwjn lY rQ isau rQ Aau gj isau gjrwj bjwvY ]sXwm BnY rn Xw ibiD BUpiq S`qRin ko jm Dwm pTwvY ]1705]
transliteration: Baaj Sio Baajan Lai Rath Sio Rath Au Gad Sio Gadraaj Bajaavai|| Syaam Bhanai Ran Yaa Bidh(i) Bhoopat(i) Shattran(i) Ko Jam Dhaam Pathaavai||1705||
translation: He caused the horses to collide with horses, the chariots to collide with chariots and the elephants to collide with the elephants; in this way, according to the poet, he began to dispatch the enemy to the abode of Yama.1705.

gurmukhi: hÍY kY sucyq cFXo rQ sXwm mhw mn BIqr kop bFXo hY ]Awpn paurK soaU sMBwr kY mXwnhu qy krvwr kFXo hY ]
transliteration: Kvai Kai Souchet Chadhyo Rath Syaam Mahaa Man Bheetar Kop Badhyo Hai Oopan Paurakh Sooo Sanbhaar Kai Myaanoh Te Karvaar Kadhyo Hai||
translation: When Krishna regained consciousness, he mounted on his chariot in great ire and thinking of his great strength, he drew his sword from the scabbard;

gurmukhi: Dwie pry irs Kwie GnI Air rwie mno iniD nIr hFXo hY ]qwn kmwnin mwrq bwnn sUrn ky icq caup cFXo hY ]1706]
transliteration: Dhaae Dare Ris Khaae Ghaniar(i) Mano Nidh(i) Neer Hadhyo Hai|| Taan Kamaanan(i) Maarat Baanan Sooran Ke Chit Chaoup Chadhyo Hai||1706||
translation: Getting highly enraged, he fell upon the terrible enemy like the sea; the warriors also pulled their bows and began to discharge arrows in excitement.1706.
